quality_assessment: The introduction is comprehensive and well-structured, covering the core purpose and features of Debtmap effectively. However, it's missing the newly implemented validate-improvement command and has a few minor terminology and consistency issues. The chapter does an excellent job communicating the value proposition and differentiating Debtmap from competitors.

issues.description: The introduction lists only 4 commands (analyze, validate, compare, init) but the codebase has implemented a 5th command 'validate-improvement' which is fully functional and important for automated validation workflows
issues.should_add: Document the validate-improvement command which validates that refactoring improved code quality by comparing before/after analysis results against thresholds
issues.fix_suggestion: Add to Commands section: '**`validate-improvement`** - Validate refactoring improvements against quality thresholds (automates verification that changes actually improved code quality)'
issues.source_reference: features.json:135-151 (cli_commands.validate-improvement with description, options, and use_cases)

issues.description: Line 65 mentions '.debtmap.toml or debtmap.toml' for configuration, but features.json indicates the config file supports TOML/JSON/YAML formats, not just TOML
issues.should_be: - **Configuration file** - `.debtmap.toml`, `debtmap.toml` (supports TOML/JSON/YAML formats) for project-specific settings
issues.fix_suggestion: Update to mention all supported formats to avoid confusion: 'Configuration file - `.debtmap.toml` or `debtmap.toml` (TOML/JSON/YAML formats supported) for project-specific settings'

issues.description: The target audience section doesn't mention CI/CD engineers or DevOps teams, which are significant users of the validate and validate-improvement commands for automated quality gates
issues.should_add: Add CI/CD engineers/DevOps teams as a target audience who use validate and validate-improvement commands
issues.fix_suggestion: Add bullet: '**CI/CD Engineers** - Enforce quality gates with `validate` command. Automate refactoring verification with `validate-improvement` for continuous quality monitoring in pipelines.'
issues.source_reference: features.json:93-116 (validate use_cases: Quality gate enforcement, CI/CD integration), features.json:145-150 (validate-improvement use_cases: Automated validation workflows, CI/CD quality checks)

issues.description: Line 18 claims 'reducing false positives by up to 70%' but lacks context about what the baseline comparison is (70% compared to what?)
issues.current_content: reducing false positives by up to 70%. This is achieved through an advanced token classification system
issues.should_be: Provide context for the 70% claim (e.g., compared to simple cyclomatic complexity metrics or traditional analyzers)
issues.fix_suggestion: Add context: 'reducing false positives by up to 70% compared to traditional complexity-only analyzers by distinguishing genuinely complex code from repetitive patterns'

issues.description: Line 38 lists 'Token classification system' as a separate feature, but it's actually a component of the 'Reduced false positives' feature mentioned on line 37 and explained on line 18. This creates potential confusion.
issues.current_content: - **Token classification system** - Advanced token categorization with weighted entropy for accurate complexity assessment
issues.should_be: This should either be removed (since it's already covered in line 18 as part of entropy analysis) or clarified as a technical detail
issues.fix_suggestion: Remove this bullet point or rephrase as: '- **Token-based complexity assessment** - (part of entropy analysis) Advanced token categorization system for distinguishing patterns from complexity'
issues.source_reference: Line 18 already explains: 'This is achieved through an advanced token classification system that categorizes code tokens'

issues.description: Line 60 mentions 'location options (local/shared)' but features.json indicates custom path is also supported
issues.current_content: - **Intelligent caching** - Smart cache system with automatic pruning, configurable strategies (LRU, LFU, FIFO), location options (local/shared), and environment-based configuration for fast repeated analysis
issues.should_be: - **Intelligent caching** - Smart cache system with automatic pruning, configurable strategies (LRU, LFU, FIFO), location options (local/shared/custom path), and environment-based configuration for fast repeated analysis
issues.fix_suggestion: Add '/custom path' after 'local/shared' to be complete

issues.description: The tip suggests starting with '--summary' which is good, but doesn't mention other useful beginner flags like '--threshold-preset' or '--top N' for focusing analysis
issues.current_content: **Tip:** Start with `debtmap analyze . --summary` for a quick overview of your codebase health before diving into detailed analysis.
issues.should_add: Mention additional useful flags for beginners
issues.fix_suggestion: Expand tip: '**Tip:** Start with `debtmap analyze . --summary` for a quick overview, or use `--top 10` to focus on highest-priority items. Consider `--threshold-preset balanced` for typical projects or `strict` for high-quality standards.'
issues.source_reference: features.json:615-627 (best_practices.analysis_workflow mentions threshold presets and filtering)

Strong emphasis on actionable guidance and quantified impact

Comprehensive coverage of multi-language support (Rust, Python, JS, TS) with feature differences
Good navigation links to related chapters at the end
